ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: yes, if they were looking for a course that taught you a lot about a lot of different viruses i would say go for it
I would describe it as a well organized walk through the world of viruses at the molecular level, and would recommend it to other students.
a lecture-based overview of major virus families

A survey of relevant DNA and RNA viruses, with particular emphasis on medicinal relevance.Yes, would recommend. No reason not to. It feels like a seminar, which is nice. There is a decent amount of material covered.

Microbiology 734 gives a general overview of virus several virus families, highlighting replication strategies and special characteristics of certain viruses. I would recommend the class to another student who is interested in virology since it gives a good introduction to many viruses.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: it was a great course for me, i haven't taken virology before and i work on HIV proteins so this class gave me great background information
My dissertation work will be on viral entry ...

The course gave me a good overview of viruses that I had not previously studied and helped me broaden my knowledge of virology in general. It also helped me understand some of the basic contributions of virology to molecular biology (ie: restriction enzymes, oncogenes, etc.)
